content: तमस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [तम्-असुन्] {@--1@} Darkness; किं वाऽभविष्यदरुणस्तमसां विभेत्ता तं चेत्सहस्रकिरणो धुरि नाकरिष्यत् <ls>Ś. 7. 4</ls>; <ls>V. 1. 7</ls>; <ls>Me. 37.</ls> {@--2@} The gloom or darkness of hell; <ls>Ms. 4. 242.</ls> {@--3@} Mental darkness, illusion, error; मुनिसुताप्रणयस्मृतिरोधिना मम च मुक्तमिदं तमसा मनः <ls>Ś. 6. 7.</ls> {@--4@} (In Sān. <ab>phil.</ab>) Darkness or ignorance, as one of the three qualities or constituents of every thing in nature (the other two being सत्त्व and रजस्); <ls>Ku. 6. 60</ls>; <ls>Ms. 12. 24.</ls> {@--5@} Grief, sorrow. {@--6@} Sin. {%--<ab>m.</ab>%} , {%--<ab>n.</ab>%} An epithet of Rāhu.
